intro: Acioa barteri, commonly known as the Barter's acacia, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Acioa barteri is adapted to arid environments and has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
